ETYMOLOGY: From English 'carry' (from Old North French 'carier' 'to load a wagon', from Latin 'carrus' 'wheeled vehicle') + '-er' (agent suffix).
SINCE: Late 14th century (general sense); specific senses emerged later.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person or thing that carries or conveys something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 运送或输送某物的人或事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The bike has a rear carrier for groceries.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这辆自行车有一个后置物架可以放杂货。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A company that transports goods or people for payment; a transport company.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 以收取报酬为目的运送货物或乘客的公司；运输公司。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We chose a reliable carrier to ship the fragile items.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们选择了一家可靠的承运商来运输易碎物品。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An individual who harbors a pathogen without exhibiting symptoms, but can transmit it to others.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 携带病原体但未表现出症状，却能将其传播给他人的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was identified as a carrier of the genetic condition.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她被确认为这种遗传病的携带者。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large warship with a deck for taking off and landing aircraft (short for 'aircraft carrier').
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种大型军舰，甲板用于飞机的起降（“航空母舰”的简称）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The carrier deployed to the region as a show of force.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这艘航空母舰部署到该地区以展示武力。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A company that provides telecommunications services, such as mobile phone service or internet access.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 提供电信服务（如移动电话服务或互联网接入）的公司。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She switched her mobile phone plan to a different carrier for better coverage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她将手机套餐转到了另一家运营商，以获得更好的网络覆盖。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A device used to carry a baby or small child close to the parent's body.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种用于将婴儿或幼儿背负在父母身体附近的装置。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new mother bought a comfortable baby carrier for her infant.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新妈妈为她的婴儿买了一个舒适的婴儿背带。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun (n.) is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A substance or entity that transports or holds another substance or signal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 输送或承载另一种物质或信号的物质或实体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In radio transmission, the information is modulated onto a carrier wave.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在无线电传输中，信息被调制到载波上。

REGISTER: Common in general, business, and scientific contexts.
